TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TemplatedWizardStep extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase

Docs.summary: Represents a step in a wizard control that can be customized through the use of templates.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep> class is provided to enable developers to apply a template to the steps in a control that acts as a wizard. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep> class is intended to be used primarily by control developers.
You can apply a theme to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep>.
## Examples The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep> class allows you to customize the content and navigation templates within it. The following example shows how to define a template-based wizard step.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplate%2A> property allows you to take full control of the navigation block, usually displayed at the bottom of the current view. Normally, you fill the navigation block with a series of buttons. However, other controls are acceptable as long as they support command bubbling, as does the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep/CS/templatedwizardstepcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep/VB/templatedwizardstepvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.value: An object that contains the template for displaying the content of a step in a control.

Docs.summary: Gets the container that a control uses to create a template for a step.
Docs.value: A that contains the template for a step.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the syntax includes setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.ContentTemplateContainer%2A> property, it is for internal use only, so the property is effectively read-only.

public: virtual property System::Web::UI::ITemplate ^ CustomNavigationTemplate { System::Web::UI::ITemplate ^ get(); void set(System::Web::UI::ITemplate ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the navigation user interface (UI) of a step in a control.
Docs.value: An object that contains the template for displaying the navigation UI of a step in a control.

Docs.summary: Gets the container that a control uses to create a template for a step.
Docs.value: A that contains the template for a step.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the syntax includes setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplateContainer%2A> property, it is for internal use only, so the property is effectively read-only. Your code should verify that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplateContainer%2A> property is not `null` before referencing it.
This property is not bindable in visual designers, but is bindable at runtime. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.BindableAttribute>.
